Some [[language]]s, such as ancient [[Greek language|Greek]], are better than [[English language|English]] at distinguishing between the different senses in which the word love is used. For example, ancient Greek has the words "philia," "eros", "agape", "storge" referring to love between friends, romantic/sexual love, sacrificial (unreciprocated) love, and affection/familial love respectively. However, with Greek as with many other languages, it has been historically difficult to separate the meanings of these words totally, and so we can find examples of, for example, ''agape'' being used with much the same meaning as ''eros''.

Interpersonal relations
  +   +
Oneself awareness is possible thanks to the concept of difference. Without the others, a person can not show its own personnality. It is the importance of being recognised. That action can also be done towards only one other person.
  +   +   +
There are three different types of love.
  +
Eros is an uncontrollable love dedicated to desire, passion, selfishness and emptiness. It is dedicated to failure or can only succeed in death. It is the passion that starves and tortures. Man seeks what he lacks, he wants to satisfy his desires. The human being wants to make one with the person he or she misses. He/she wants to definitively unite and find itself in that person, but this can only lead to failure. Plato tells us that love is not completeness but incompleteness. The lack of happiness is love itself. This is the basis of Plato’s famous quote : There is no happy love. Love abolishes itself in satisfaction. Love can only be saved by death or religion by aiming towards Good. It is the ascending dialectic.
  +   +
Philia. We can desire what we have, what we do, and what exists. It other words, to act, to be joyfull and to rejoice. And this is what refutes platonism. There is the love that we are subjected to, and that is passion ; there is love that we do or give, and that is action. We have friends and we love them. To love is to be able to be happy or to rejoice about something. “There isn’t love but in joy, there isn’t joy but in loving”, Spinoza said. Philia in greek means friendship. Friendship is comparable to a projection of our love for ourselves onto others. It is the joy to love and to be loved. For a couple to continue to desire eachother, that couple must transform their pleasure for passion into joy, gentleness, happiness in being together, into philia. They will pass from a mad love to a wise love. A happy couple is a space of trust, intimacy, reciprocal joy, fidelity, generosity, humour and love. The family is the future of the couple. How could we love if no-one had ever loved us before ? We love our children. We don’t make them to posess them, but we make them knowing they will leave one day. St-Thomas once said : “To love is to want the Good for someone”. (aimer, c’est vouloir du bien à cette personne). We have to pass from a love that takes to a love that gives, from violence to gentleness, from eros to philia.
  +
  +
Agape or God’s love.
  +
The strongest love is the impartial love, the one that loves universally without justification. The word agape comes from de verb agapan which means “to welcome with friendship”, to love, to cherish. God created by love, for love. God leaves us the choice, He withdraws to give us space. The withdrawing, the gentleness to exists less, to afirm ones self less, the auto-limitation of ones power, that is love, free love, pure love. God doesn’t love us for what we are, but because He is Love. Charity is linked with the lack of Good. It only begins with the friendship-love that we have for God. We are all brothers in front of death and life. Agape love is universal. It is love having become permanent and unchangeable through time, extended to all men and to the whole being. Charity is love liberated from ego.
  +   +
Love is thus “the feeling of missing something oe somebody”, passion, shared or received joy, friendship, but also joy given freely, charity.
  +
There is a love that is like a hunger, another that echoes like a laugh. Charity looks more like a smile or when it is not the case, a tear.
  +   +   +
The love for mystery and initiation begins with the eros type of love. Love seems so strong and intense that it deforms the correct jugements about the person we love. Don’t we say : Love is blind ? We don’t immediately see the “bad” side of the partner, these are hidden by the intense love that we feel for her or him. That is what repairs every little quarel quite fast, since to our eyes the other seems perfect.
  +
Allthough, with time, the intensity of that love diminishes and that is the time when blind love doesn’t hide anymore all the negative sides of the other. With time and habit, these imperfections will become almost omnipresent and annoying. That is what will lead the couple to it’s critical phase.
  +
The agape form of love is much less present in these two first phases. It mostly intervenes in the ageing phase. That love is defined as not related to desire or reciprocal need. The man or woman that has loved and lived with a person during a whole life, that has gone through many chalenges with him or her, doesn’t need to feel that the other loves him or her. At this stage, love is not a feeling but a state. That being can thus love the other without worrying that it is reciprocal, that reciprocality at this stage is natural, omnipresent.
  +
The physical desire at this stage is less present. They have certainly desired each other before. The desire comes before the first phase.
  +
Another particularity of that love is that the acts that it inspires aren’t determined by the fact that we are loved. This form of love is well adapted for this phase of ageing.
  +
Philia is very important in the life of the couple in general. Even though it is an egoistic love, the fact that the being asks to be loved to be able to love in return is indispensable for the couple’s love to pass through time. Even if a person loves very strongly his partner, if he or she doesn’t have the impression of being loved in return, the critical phase could come very soon and could probably break the couple. The need of reciprocality of love is thus indispensable in a couple. Without this solidarity, the couple won’t get far.
  +
Love is also the search of beauty in which human can procreate. Today we can see certain couples getting married but not having children. An example would be homosexual couples. Even if couples want to have children, it is certainly not because they want to survive through infinity.
  +
Commitment doesn’t necessarily lead to a wedding, but mariage means commitment. Two persons that love each other can live together without getting married. But they do make commitments towards each other when they buy a house together, have children together, …
  +   +   +
Here is the point of view of a university student :
  +   +
According to me, love represents the link that binds a man and a woman. This link does not necessarily mean mariage. The love I am talking about represents the feelings one person has towards another without necessarily having the reciprocal. That is the love that permits two persons to really unite in happiness. That feeling is a feeling of well-being when in presence of the person chosen by destiny. It is self-evident that love is not chosen, even if it can be manipulated. We can distinguish a few ways to fall in love. One of the major ones, that has made lots of ink flow in novels: love at first sight. It can happen at any time of your life as it can also never happen. Love at first sight makes the touched person enter a new world where reason loses it’s sense when in presence of the loved one. He lives only for the other. We can call this passion. It is passion that reanimates the hearts of men when in presence of their loved one, it is that passion that permits us to lift up mountains but also send a man that was happy one day, into a deep interior isolation the next day.
  +
Love is not only positive, it can make us stronger, but it can also destroy or bring down a person. We’ve stoped counting the sucidal cases for love. Love destroys when the reciprocal is not made. The person then falls in a world of fantasms where the loved one is the main actor. He only thinks of her. He dedicates his body and soul to her, hoping to change her heart. The passion appears and becomes bigger and stronger with the refusal of the loved one.
  +
But what become of the love of the one that has loved so much and that has “succeeded in conquering". It is not the same anymore, he cannot love in the same way. The so wanted loved one is finally his. The passion diminishes, making place for a sure monotony in the couple formed on fantasms. That passion isn’t the same anymore. The loved one doesn’t become a fantasm anymore because fantasms are dreams about what we desire most. At this point, the quest for another fansasm begins, otherwise the couple could get destroyed by weariness. This it what often happens when two persons love each other enormously. They first live each on their side, seing the other once in a while. But one day, one of them makes the step and asks the other in mariage. At that moment, there is a disruption in the couple, the woman must take care of her husband, must cook him supper, … She will soon find out that she hadn’t so much work before she got married. Of course this is a dark aspect of mariage, but it represents the evolution of love in a couple.
  +
Love is so strong in men and women that it permits to unite them, to destroy them, to build them up, but it is at the same time so fragile. Especially these days when the “free couple” is more and more a fashion. Youngsters go out more, learn sooner that they can love and take pleasure in the presence of others, but that sort of love is often precarious and is part of our education. Youngsters flirt more easily, taking the risk to hurt someone. They are still unconscious of what love is really about. But we should leave them that way, because they havn’t yet been touched by the effects of the double sided love.
  +
That fragility of love aslo comes from the fact that we think more and more of ourselves, that we try at any price not to suffer. We don’t necessarily seek the great love like in the past. We are not attracted to that, but we keep our fantasms. These are nourished by all the images the actual mediatic society offers us. But these medias offer us perfection in plastic bodies that we can hardly find in reality. We learn to fantasm on something that we will never have. At this moment, we learn new values from the opposite sex, we try to understand better, we find other qualities that the medias cannot bring us. This love that appears is not passionate love, but a sentimental love. That is where the fragility of that love comes from, the feelings, are able to change in one way or another rapidly.
  +
To conclude, we are all touched by love one day or another, but never do we learn to handle it. This is done in an empirical way and it is often not conclusive. We are thus almost all touched by the misdeeds of love. But these are only temporary, latter we will recognise a love eslewhere and that one will maybe be the one that will make us happy.
  +   +   +
The Greeks had understood the complexity of this emotion and subdivided it into three parts : "philia", "eros" and "agape".
  +
During the 12th century, we found this ambiguity in the myth of Tristand and Iseult. This myth was conveided by the people. We can find in it all the concepts linked to love. This myth associates this feeling to suffering. At the end of the myth, the two heroes die because of their love, because of the passion that they had one for the other.
  +
We have been able to understand through all the studies made on love that this feeling enables us to enrich our lives and provides us a certain joy that is hard to define.
  +
Nowadays, love is still evolving. A few years ago, we were in a hurry to get married and get ourselves engaged, but now, we live more or less a love of non-engagement. We prefer to stay a little more independent, which is often badly understood by our parents.
  +
Love can be understood like being the need of someone close and stable to “build oursleves up”, then making ourselves immortal by having children and thus living in them. That feeling doesn’t create itself in one go. There are different stages by which we have to pass before reaching the love that we will know until our death. These different phases aren’t always easy, and it is in this that we can see if the loved one is really the one of our heart.
  +
In this text, we have concentrated ourselves on the love in a couple, but this feeling is much wider.
  +
Thus we can discover love, endure love and live love, but without it, we wouldn’t be.
  +   +   +

Love does not count up wrongs that have been done. Love is not happy with evil but is happy with the truth. Love patiently accepts all things. It always trust, always hopes, and always remains strong.
